snippet: Under President Obama’s budget proposal, deductions for tax breaks like mortgage interest and contributions to charities would be capped at a maximum rate of 28 percent.
abstract: Pres Obama, outlining his budget proposals to Congress, pushes to raise more than $600 billion in new revenue, mainly by curbing deductions for the most affluent taxpayers and forcing millionaires to pay minimum rate of 30 percent; deductions for tax breaks like mortgage interest and contributions to charities, would be capped at maximum rate of 28 percent.
lead_paragraph: Under President Obama’s budget proposal, deductions for tax breaks like mortgage interest and contributions to charities would be capped at a maximum rate of 28 percent.

headline.main: White House Budget Curbs Some Deductions for the Wealthy
headline.print_headline: White House Budget Curbs Some Deductions for the Wealthy
